intro: Helianthella cannonae, commonly known as the Cannon's globemallow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Helianthella cannonae is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
